results.title: Lady Baden Powell in Victoria, 1967
results.brief_description: Lady Baden Powell was the guest of Sir Rohan and Lady Delacombe on this her 5th visit to Australia. Shows enthusiastic receptions at Britannia Park Guide Training Centre, a social at the Exhibition Buildings, a luncheon at Rotary Headquarters, and Festival of Friendship at Festival Hall. Functions were attended by Scouts, Rangers, Guides and Brownies from all over the State. Photography by Betty Reynolds.

results.title: LAcrosse; lacrosse
results.brief_description: A slow-motion exploration of the grace and beauty of the women’s game of lacrosse featuring the United States Women’s Lacrosse Association. The women’s game differs significantly in spirit and in rule from the men’s game in that the women have eliminated boundaries and disallowed body contact.

results.title: La Traversee de Paris = Four Bags Full
results.brief_description:
A wealthy artist and a simple cab driver join up to transport four suitcases of blackmarket pork across Paris during the Occupation, dodging German roadblocks, hungry dogs and collaborators. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1956: Best Actor for Bourvil.

Credits: Producer, Yves Laplanche ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Bourvil, Louis de Funes, Janette Batti, Robert Arnoux, Georgette Anys, Anouk Ferjac, Bernard Lajarrigue.

results.title: La Modification = the Modification
results.brief_description:
A husband recalls his past experiences as he travels by train to Rome from Paris. He has just left his wife for his mistress and flashbacks are employed to tell his story. He thinks of his future in Rome with his mistress as he fondly remembers the highpoints of his mariage.

Credits: Producer, Rene Thevenet ; director, Michel Worms ; writers, Michel Worms, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Daniel Vogel ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Maurice Ronet, Silva Koscina, Luis Massoli, Bernard Jeantet, Philippe Chauveau [narration].

results.title: La Maison des Bories = the House of the Bories
results.brief_description:
Carl is the young scholar who comes to live with French geologist Julian and his wife Isabelle and two children. Carl is eager to study with the famous geologist, but soon he is involved in a love affair with his mentor’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; writer, Anne Tromelin ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Marie Dubois, Maurice Garrel, Helene Vallier, Mathieu Cariere, Veronique Maurin.

results.title: La Lutte contre le froid
results.creator_credit: Henri Gruel and Son et Lumiere
results.brief_description: An amusing and well made cartoon, light heartedly pouring scorn on our feeble efforts throughout the centuries to keep warm and resist the hardy since it can be used in so many forms and the widest range of heating systems. Blends animation and live action in an incisive and witty manner which can be enjoyed as much for its vigorous invention as for the precision of its technique.

results.title: La Gueule de L'autre = the Other One's Mug
results.brief_description:
Martial Perrin is campaigning for the country’s presidency at the helm of the Conservatist Independant and Progressist Party. After his campaign staff learns of an assasination plot, Martial is driven into hiding and ‘replaced’ by an ineffectual actor.

Credits: Producer, Georges Valon ; director, Pierre Tchernia ; writer, Jean Poiret ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Claude Bolling ; art direction, Willy Holt.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Jean Poiret, Andrea Parisy, Bernadette Lafont, Curd Jurgens, Francois Lalande, Dominique Lavanant, Hans Meyer, Georges Geret, Marco Perrin, Patrick Poivre d’Arvor.

results.title: La Griffe et la Dent = Fang and Claw
results.creator_credit: Francois Bel, Gerard Vienne and Walter Spohr
results.brief_description:
Without narration, this wildlife documentary explores the behavior of African animals by day and by night, and is especially vivid in its depiction of the hunting behavior of large predators.

Credits: Producer, Walter Spohr ; directors, Gerard Vienne, Francois Bel ; music, Michel Fano.

results.title: La Garonne
results.brief_description: One of a series of teaching films with commentary in simple french. Sketches the outlines of france and the course of the river with its tributaries, before presenting its source in the Pyrenees whose peaks we see as we descend close to the torrent through gorges and ravines.

results.title: La Femme Aux Bottes Rouges = the Woman with Red Boots
results.creator_credit: Juan Bunuel, Jordan Bojillon and Raymond Vogel
results.brief_description:
Francoise Leroy, a young and unknown writer, has supernatural gifts. She becomes acquainted with Perou, an old millionaire who loathes artists. Perou is smitten by the young woman whom he saw naked once. He starts stalking her and discovers she lives with Richard, a painter, but that she is secretely attracted to Marc, her publisher, to whom she sends letters. Perou intercepts these letters and sends replies to Francoise, pretending to be Marc. Then, he proceeds to help Marc, who is married, to kill his wife. Finally, he invites the young woman and her two rival lovers to spend time at his house. There, the final show down takes place between an old man who has already destroyed several artists’ lives and the young woman with strange powers.

Credits: Producers, Jordan Bojillon, Raymond Vogel ; director, Juan Bunuel ; writers, Jean-Claude Carriere, Juan Bunuel, Pierre-Jean Maintigneux, Clem Wood ; photography, Leopold Villasenor.
Cast: Catherine Deneuve, Fernando Rey, Jacques Weber, Adalberto-Maria Merli, Jose Sacristan, Emma Cohen, Laura Betti.
